intro: Geissois biagiana, commonly known as the Philippine mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
